recipes.sourceName: All Day I Dream About Food

extendedIngredients.name: shredded mexican cheese blend
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese or Mexican Blend

recipes.title: Low Carb Mexican Cauliflower Rice Skillet Dinner

winePairing.pairingText: Mexican can be paired with Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. One wine you could try is The Donum Estate Russian River Valley Pinot Noir. It has 4.9 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 67 dollars.

productMatches.title: The Donum Estate Russian River Valley Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: This Pinot Noir displays abundant and intense aromas of ripe black fruits, including cherry, plum and raspberry, in a complex and concentrated nose. Smooth and richly textured, the wine offers great depth of black cherry, berry and cola flavors with notes of mineral and spice on a bright and long-lasting finish.

recipes.instructions: In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef until almost cooked through (just a little pink). Add the onion and pepper and continue to cook until no longer pink. Stir in the taco seasoning.Add the tomatoes and cauliflower rice and stir to combine. Stir in the broth and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium low and cook until the cauliflower rice begins to soften (8 to 10 minutes for frozen).Sprinkle the skillet with the cheese and cover. Let cook until the cheese is melted, 3 or 4 minutes. Remove from heat and top with your favourite toppings like sour cream, avocado, and chopped cilantro.

steps.step: In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef until almost cooked through (just a little pink).
Add the onion and pepper and continue to cook until no longer pink. Stir in the taco seasoning.

Add the tomatoes and cauliflower rice and stir to combine. Stir in the broth and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium low and cook until the cauliflower rice begins to soften (8 to 10 minutes for frozen).Sprinkle the skillet with the cheese and cover.
Let cook until the cheese is melted, 3 or 4 minutes.
Remove from heat and top with your favourite toppings like sour cream, avocado, and chopped cilantro.
